taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. L. P. de Candolle

place_of_publication.publication_title: in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. L. P. de Candolle, Prodr.

taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek monos , single, and lopos , husk, alluding to phyllaries]

bio:treatment.description: Dioecious. Plants 3–14 cm (bases woody). Stolons none. Basal leaves absent at flowering. Cauline leaves linear-lanceolate to cuneate-oblanceolate, 11–35 × 2–6 mm, acute, not flagged (apices acute), faces gray-pubescent. Heads 3–25 in corymbiform to paniculiform arrays. Involucres: staminate 6–8 mm; pistillate 6–8 mm. Phyllaries distally red to pink, light brown, or white. Corollas: staminate 3–4.5 mm; pistillate 5–6 mm. Cypselae 2–2.5 mm, pubescent and papillate; pappi: staminate 6–7 mm (capillary); pistillate 6–7 mm. 2n = 28.

key_statement.description: Ray lamina apices entire or obscurely to slightly lobed (mid lobes shorter than outers); disc cypselae ± prismatic (not obcompressed).
Cypselae ca. 2 mm, glabrous or sparsely hairy (branches spreading, usually distal)
Ray lamina apices usually ± equally 3-lobed (laminae sometimes inconspicuous); disc cypselae obcompressed.
Ray laminae ca. 0.5 mm (inconspicuous); disc cypselae 2-angled (pappi of 2–7 scales)
Phyllaries distinct or connate (± 1 / 2 their lengths); cypselae uniformly gray-strigose
Phyllaries connate (± 3 / 4 their lengths, forming cups with distinct triangular lobes); cypselae glabrous or apically hairy
